citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The food preparation area inside the animal building and the surrounding grounds outside the animal building are in need
of cleaning and general housekeeping. There was an accumulation of caked dirt, debris and cobwebs behind and under
shelving along the walls and windows of the food preparation area. Miscellaneous items and tools not for animal purposes
are being stored in this area and collecting a layer of dust. The animal refrigerator had a buildup of a dark colored, grimy
material along the bottom shelves and on the inside of the door and seals. At the front, outside entrance to the animal
building were several, unorganized and stacked miscellaneous items including animal carriers, tools, bags of wood pellets
and spilled pellets and sacks on the ground. Unkept animal areas and premises where housing facilities are located may
cause harm to the animals or may contribute to the harborage of rodents and pests which may spread disease.
Premises where housing facilities are located, including buildings and surrounding grounds, must be kept clean and in
good repair in order to protect the nonhuman primates from injury, to facilitate the husbandry practices required in this
subpart, and to reduce or eliminate breeding and living areas for rodents, pests, and vermin. Premises must be kept free
of accumulations of trash, junk, waste, and discarded matter.
Correct by 09/09/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.84(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The food preparation area inside the animal building and the surrounding grounds outside the animal building are in need 
of cleaning and general housekeeping. There was an accumulation of caked dirt, debris and cobwebs behind and under 
shelving along the walls and windows of the food preparation area. Miscellaneous items and tools not for animal purposes 
are being stored in this area and collecting a layer of dust. The animal refrigerator had a buildup of a dark colored, grimy 
material along the bottom shelves and on the inside of the door and seals. At the front, outside entrance to the animal 
building were several, unorganized and stacked miscellaneous items including animal carriers, tools, bags of wood pellets 
and spilled pellets and sacks on the ground. Unkept animal areas and premises where housing facilities are located may 
cause harm to the animals or may contribute to the harborage of rodents and pests which may spread disease. 
Premises where housing facilities are located, including buildings and surrounding grounds, must be kept clean and in 
good repair in order to protect the nonhuman primates from injury, to facilitate the husbandry practices required in this 
subpart, and to reduce or eliminate breeding and living areas for rodents, pests, and vermin. Premises must be kept free 
of accumulations of trash, junk, waste, and discarded matter. 
 
Correct by 09/09/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
